availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, lawyer. Tennessee native. Married to Sallie Morrow. Father of Robertson and Emily Morrow. Sheriff in Paducah, Kentucky in 1850. Lawyer in Paducah, Kentucky in 1860. Kentucky delegate to the Democratic National Convention in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah and Suburbs, p. 144A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, p. 135.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 166B.
M. Halsted, Caucuses of 1860. A History of the National Political Conventions of the Current Presidential Campaign (Columbus, OH: Follett, Foster and Company, 1860), 16.
Find A Grave, "George Henry Morrow (1826-1877)," Memorial #101858092, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101858092 (accessed July 2, 2019).
